comment: Metres listed by Shatavadhani Dr. R. Ganesh as the most notable ones.

metres.comment: This is the most popular metre in Sanskrit literature.
examples: cetaso 'stu prasādāya / satām prācetaso muniḥ // pṛthivyām padya-nirmāṇa-/vidyāyāḥ prathamam padam //
sujanaṃ vyajanam manye / cāru-vaṃśa-samudbhavam // ātmānaṃ tu paribhrāmya / para-tāpa-nivārakam //

metres.comment: The four pādas have 12, 18, 12, and 15 mātrās respectively.
examples: āparitoṣād viduṣāṃ / na sādhu manye prayogavijñānaṃ // balavadapi śikṣitānām / ātmany apratyayaṃ cetaḥ
nītijñā niyatijñā / vādajñā api bhavanti vedajñāḥ // brahmajñā api labhyā // svājñāna-jñānino viralāḥ

metres.comment: The four pādas have 12, 18, 12, and 18 mātrās respectively.
examples: nindatu vā nandatu vā / mandamanīṣā niśamya kṛtim etām // harṣaṃ vā marṣaṃ vā / sarṣapamātram api naiva vindema
kalamañjula-vāganumita-/ galapañjara-gataśukagrahautkaṇṭhyāt // amba radanāmbaraṃ te / bimbaphalaṃ śambarāriṇā nyastam
